messages.content: What is the purpose of the PromptJSON node in ComfyUI?

The PromptJSON node in ComfyUI structures natural language prompts and generates prompts for external LLM nodes in image generation workflows, aiding in creating consistent, schema-based image descriptions.
What are some of the features of the PromptJSON node?

The PromptJSON node supports various schema types, multiple prompt generation strategies, negative prompts, adjustable complexity for output detail, and custom schema support for fine-tuning prompt structure.
How can the PromptJSON node be installed?
The PromptJSON node can be installed using the comfy manager 'Install via git' option or by cloning the repository into your ComfyUI custom nodes directory and restarting ComfyUI.
What are the inputs and outputs of the PromptJSON node?

The inputs for the PromptJSON node include prompt, negative_prompt, complexity, llm_prompt_type, schema_type, and custom_schema. The outputs are system_prompt, user_prompt, negative_passthru, and schema.
What are the two LLM prompt types supported by PromptJSON?

The PromptJSON node supports two LLM prompt types: One Shot and Few Shot. One Shot provides a single example of a structured response, while Few Shot provides multiple examples at different complexity levels.
What are the schema types available in the PromptJSON node?
The PromptJSON node supports schema types such as JSON, HTML, Key, Attribute-Based, Visual Layer Breakdown, Compositional Grid, and Artistic Reference.
How does the custom schema feature work in the PromptJSON node?
The custom schema feature in the PromptJSON node allows you to define the structure of the output, with the format depending on the chosen schema type, such as JSON.
What is the purpose of the complexity parameter in the PromptJSON node?
The complexity parameter in the PromptJSON node is used to control the level of detail in the generated prompts.
